scheduling for work orders Work Order Schedule
section.para: To view Work Order schedules, select the "Work Order Schedule" option. The following screen will appear:

tip.para: To edit a Work Order after it has been created, use the right-click menu in any of the "Work Order Schedule by..." displays. There you will find an "Edit W/O" option.

section.para: When displaying Work Order schedules by Planner Code, you are presented with the following options:

note.para: The system-defined default filter on the Work Order Schedule screen shows all open Work Orders.

listitem.para: Select to display Work Order schedules for all Planner Codes.
Specify Planner Code whose Work Order schedule you want to display.
Enter a Planner Code pattern to select a range of Planner Codes. Refine your search using Regular Expressions.
Specify the range of Work Order start dates you want to include in the display:
Work Orders scheduled on and after this date will be displayed.
Work Orders scheduled on and before this date will be displayed.
Select to display Work Order schedules by Planner Code for all Sites.
Specify Site whose Work Order schedules by Planner Code you want to display.
Specify which Work Order statuses you want to include in the display:
Select to include open ("O") Work Orders in the display.
Select to include exploded ("E") Work Orders in the display.
Select to include released ("R") Work Orders in the display.
Select to include in-process ("I") Work Orders in the display.
Specify how many levels of Work Orders you want to include in the display:

Select to display only top level Work Orders. Top level Work Orders are Work Orders that have not been created to meet the component demands of a parent Work Order. If not selected, multiple level Work Orders will be shown.

Display lists Work Order schedules by Planner Code, using the specified parameters. The start dates and end dates are color-coded for ease of use. Both dates will display in red type if the Work Order is not yet in-process and is also past due. Once a Work Order's Status is changed to in-process ("I"), the start date will automatically revert to black type.
Top level Work Orders are Work Orders that have not been created to meet the component demands of a parent Work Order.
